html:
8.30.17  8:06 pm   Hey, I asked the question about that 5,5,6 triplet thing! So, the song is in 4/4 time (slower tempo, about 80bpm). The full measure is a dotted eighth, then a sixteenth note tied to a quarter note, then that 5,5,6, triplet thing. So that 5,5,6 triplet should take up 2 beats. So, it's like dividing 2 beats into 3 equal parts (3:2 quarter note triplet), then taking those 3 equal parts and dividing them again into 5,5, and 6 respectively?

     This piece also has several septuplets and pentuplets and all that kind of stuff... In general, what are some good ways to figure out how to hear/play this kind of timing? I can conceptualize it, and I think I understand how it works. But the challenge is like, okay, so how do I actually play 7 equally spaced hits over the span of 2 beats, or whatever?

     I can play 3:2 1/4, 1/8, 1/16 note triplets because I hear them used all the time, and can just play it without actually counting it out, i just know how it sounds.. Is it possi ble to be able to sight read these kind of weird tuplets/polyrhythms? Or is it something that you just have to hear each particular rhythm over and over again until it sinks in?
original_html:

html: 8.29.17  7:04 pm   Hi, I was the one who asked about Ryland by Julian Lage (on World's Fair). There are really quiet notes in the first and second measures of the song (if you are thinking of it in 6/8) starting on the sixth 8th note that goes A D A D A. And the next time it happens is on the down beat of the 4th measure and the notes are G E G E. There are other times it happens with different notes too. My first guess was that they were harmonics because some of them seem out of tune but I can't figure it out.

html: 8.29.17  4:54 pm   do you sometimes think that you fit (or at least can survive) in everywhere but you belong to nowhere and you will never find your home? i do and i feel like i have to be nothing so i can be everything and i have to be nobody so i can be everybody. i thought it was what makes me write and how i became my characters and stories themselves. i became all of them, even the ones i didn't write yet. i split myself, one piece for one possibility but i can't start to do something because i am scared. there is a sea of possibilities between me and the future. like you said, i am drowning in infinity and i am broken into a thousand pieces, at the same point i was before. is this why i can't encourage myself to write again? do i have to be whole? and if yes, how can i become one again?
original_html: 8.29.17  4:54 pm   do you sometimes think that you fit (or at least can survive) in everywhere but you belong to nowhere and you will never find your home? i do and i feel like i have to be nothing so i can be everything and i have to be nobody so i can be everybody. i thought it was what makes me write and how i became my characters and stories themselves. i became all of them, even the ones i didn't write yet. i split myself, one piece for one possibility but i can't start to do something because i am scared. there is a sea of possibilities between me and the future. like you said, i am drowning in infinity and i am broken into a thousand pieces, at the same point i was before. is this why i can't encourage myself to write again? do i have to be whole? and if yes, how can i become one again?
